Description: Yellow steatite scarab: possibly fake. Engraved on the base with a defective writing of Amun-Ra, a lotus-bud on a long stalk encircling the name of the god. Hole pierced through longitudinally.
Curator's comments: For this motif, symbolising vigour and growth see for example, Newberry, 'Scarab-shaped seals' Pl. VIII 36506 where the plant also encircles the name of Amun.
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.182, no.18)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
